result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jevon T Hunt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jevon T Hunt appeared by video.  Attorney Annette E Rauch appeared by video for Jevon T Hunt.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of resolution posture and requested a plea/sentencing date. State confirmed. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. State to comply with Victim Notification.
Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Jevon T Hunt appeared by video.  Attorney Annette E Rauch appeared by video for Jevon T Hunt.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense requested status hearing to allow time to review Discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Status hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Jevon T Hunt in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Jevon T Hunt appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

NEW DATE: Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Parties can appear via Zoom or In-Person.
Clerk contacted the parties via email to RESCHEDULE Prelim hearing.

Defense Request to Adjourn Preliminary Hearing; received, filed, and forwarded to Prelim Court for review.
Defense waived time limits.

Defendant Jevon T Hunt in Court.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin before the case was called on the record.   

Case in Court for Indigency hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Statements by Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Annette Rauch to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant reimburse Milwaukee County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning October 1, 2022, and then the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Court advised Defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jevon T Hunt in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Defendant is reminded of the no contact order than remains in effect.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Donelle D.A.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Jevon T Hunt in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Jevon T Hunt in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jevon T Hunt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
